info.title: Stratum AI
info.description: Enterprise Marketing Intelligence Platform - Unified analytics across Meta, Google, TikTok & Snapchat

post.description:
Send a WhatsApp OTP verification code to the specified phone number.

The OTP is valid for 5 minutes and must be verified before registration.

Verify the WhatsApp OTP code.

Returns a verification token that must be included during registration.

Authenticate user and return access/refresh tokens.

Args:
    login_data: Email and password

Returns:
    JWT tokens for authentication

Register a new user.

Args:
    user_data: User registration details

Returns:
    Created user information

Refresh access token using refresh token.

Args:
    token_data: Refresh token

Returns:
    New access and refresh tokens

Log out the current user.

In a production system, this would invalidate the refresh token.

Self-service signup that creates a new tenant and admin user.

- Creates a new tenant (organization) with the company name
- Creates the first user as tenant admin
- Sends email verification link
- User must verify email before full access

Args:
    signup_data: Email, password, name, company details

Returns:
    User ID and verification message

Verify user email address using the token from verification email.

Args:
    verify_data: Verification token

Returns:
    Success message

Resend email verification link.

Args:
    resend_data: Email address

Returns:
    Success message (always returns success to prevent email enumeration)

Request password reset email.

Args:
    forgot_data: Email address

Returns:
    Success message (always returns success to prevent email enumeration)

Reset password using token from reset email.

Args:
    reset_data: Reset token and new password

Returns:
    Success message

Change password for authenticated user.

Requires current password for verification.

Args:
    change_data: Current and new password
    current_user: Authenticated user

Returns:
    Success message

get.description:
Get current authenticated user profile.

Args:
    current_user: Authenticated user from JWT

Returns:
    User profile information

post.description:
Start OAuth flow for a platform.

Returns an authorization URL to redirect the user to the platform's
OAuth consent screen.

Args:
    platform: Ad platform (meta, google, tiktok, snapchat)
    request_data: Optional scopes and frontend callback URL
    current_user: Authenticated and verified user

Returns:
    Authorization URL and state token

get.description:
Handle OAuth callback from platform.

This endpoint is called by the platform after user authorization.
It exchanges the authorization code for tokens and stores them.

On success, redirects to frontend with success status.
On failure, redirects to frontend with error details.

Get connection status for a platform.

Returns the current connection status, token expiry, and ad accounts count.
Get connection status for all platforms.

List available ad accounts from platform.

Fetches ad accounts from the platform API and merges with
locally stored connection status.

post.description:
Connect selected ad accounts for use in Stratum.

Creates local records for the selected accounts and enables them.
Refresh OAuth token for a platform.

delete.description:
Disconnect a platform (revoke OAuth).

This will:
- Revoke access with the platform (if supported)
- Delete stored tokens
- Mark connection as disconnected
- Disable all connected ad accounts

get.description:
Get current onboarding status and progress.

Returns all saved step data along with completion status.

post.description:
Save Step 1: Business Profile.

Captures industry, ad spend, team size, and target markets.

Save Step 2: Platform Selection.

Captures which ad platforms the tenant wants to use.

Save Step 3: Goals Setup.

Captures KPIs, targets, currency, and timezone.

Save Step 4: Automation Preferences.

Captures automation mode and notification settings.

Save Step 5: Trust Gate Configuration.

Captures trust thresholds and action limits.
This is the final step of onboarding.

Skip remaining onboarding steps.

Uses default values for uncompleted steps.
Not recommended but available for users who want to explore first.

Reset onboarding to start over.

Clears all saved preferences and resets to step 1.

get.description:
Check if onboarding is required for the current tenant.

Returns whether to show the onboarding wizard.

Get the main dashboard overview.

Returns key metrics, signal health, platform breakdown, and quick stats.

Get campaign performance for dashboard.

Returns paginated list of campaigns with key metrics and recommendations.

Get AI recommendations for the dashboard.

Returns prioritized recommendations for campaigns that need attention.

post.description:
Approve a recommendation for execution.

In autopilot mode, this queues the action for automatic execution.
In manual/assisted mode, this marks it as approved.
Reject a recommendation.

get.description:
Get recent activity feed for the dashboard.

Returns recent actions, alerts, and system events.

Get quick action buttons for the dashboard.

Returns contextual actions based on the current state.

Get detailed signal health status.

Returns the current trust gate status including EMQ, data freshness,
and any issues that may affect autopilot.
Get the current authenticated user's profile.

List all users in the tenant.
Requires admin or manager role.

post.description:
Invite a new user to the tenant.
Requires admin role.

patch.description:
Update a user's details.
Requires admin role.

delete.description:
Remove a user from the tenant (soft delete).
Requires admin role.

get.description:
List all tenants.
Requires admin role for full list, otherwise returns only user's tenant.

post.description:
Create a new tenant.
Requires admin role.

get.description: Get the current user's tenant.
Get a specific tenant by ID.

patch.description:
Update a tenant.
Admin can update any tenant, managers can update their own tenant.

delete.description:
Soft delete a tenant.
Requires admin role.

get.description: Get users count and list for a tenant.

patch.description:
Update tenant subscription plan.
Requires admin role.

Update tenant feature flags.
Requires admin role.

get.description:
List campaigns with filtering and pagination.

Args:
    page: Page number (1-indexed)
    page_size: Number of items per page
    platform: Filter by ad platform
    status: Filter by campaign status
    search: Search by name
    labels: Filter by labels

post.description: Create a new campaign.

get.description: Get detailed campaign information.

Get time-series metrics for a campaign.

Args:
    campaign_id: Campaign ID
    start_date: Start date (default: 30 days ago)
    end_date: End date (default: today)

post.description:
Trigger a manual sync for a campaign.
Queues a Celery task to fetch latest data from the ad platform.

get.description:
List creative assets with filtering.

Args:
    asset_type: Filter by asset type
    folder: Filter by folder
    tags: Filter by tags
    min_fatigue_score: Minimum fatigue score
    max_fatigue_score: Maximum fatigue score

post.description: Create a new creative asset.

get.description: Get list of unique folders.

Get assets with high fatigue scores.
Useful for identifying creatives that need refreshing.
Get asset details.

post.description:
Recalculate fatigue score for an asset.

Fatigue is calculated based on:
- Times used
- Time since first use
- CTR trend (if decreasing)
- Impressions volume

get.description: List automation rules.

post.description: Create a new automation rule.

get.description: Get rule details.

post.description: Activate a rule.
Pause a rule.

Test a rule without executing actions.
Returns what campaigns would be affected.

get.description: Get execution history for a rule.
List tracked competitors.

post.description: Add a new competitor to track.

get.description: Get share of voice comparison across all tracked competitors.
Get detailed competitor information.

post.description: Trigger a manual refresh of competitor data.

get.description: Get top keywords for a competitor.

post.description:
What-If Simulator: Predict outcomes based on budget changes.

Uses the hybrid ML strategy:
- ML_PROVIDER=local: Uses scikit-learn models
- ML_PROVIDER=vertex: Uses Google Vertex AI

ROAS Forecasting: Predict future ROAS trends.

Uses historical data to forecast ROAS for the specified period.

Conversion Prediction: Predict expected conversions based on features.

Can be used to estimate conversions for different targeting scenarios.

get.description:
Get status of ML models.

Returns information about loaded models and their versions.

Get KPI tiles for the dashboard overview.

Returns key metrics with trends.

Get demographic breakdown for campaigns.

Used for age/gender stacked bar charts.

Get location-based heatmap data.

Returns coordinates and weights for map visualization.
Get performance breakdown by ad platform.
Get daily performance trends for a specified metric.

Get analytics overview for all tenants (superadmin view).
Returns ROAS, EMQ, status, and key metrics per tenant.

Get executive summary for superadmin dashboard.
Aggregated metrics across all tenants.

post.description:
Export all data associated with a user (GDPR Data Portability).

Returns a JSON file containing all user data.

Anonymize all personal data for a user (GDPR Right to be Forgotten).

This permanently removes all PII associated with the user while preserving
non-personal data for analytics purposes.

get.description:
Get audit logs for compliance reporting.

Filterable by user, action type, resource, and date range.

post.description: Update user consent preferences.

get.description: List WhatsApp contacts with filtering and pagination.

post.description: Add a new WhatsApp contact.

Bulk import WhatsApp contacts.

Imports multiple contacts in a single request.
Skips duplicates and returns success/failure counts.
Send verification code to contact.
Opt-in a contact for WhatsApp messages.
Opt-out a contact from WhatsApp messages.

get.description: List WhatsApp message templates.

post.description: Create a new message template (will be submitted to Meta for approval).

get.description: Get a specific template by ID.

post.description: Queue a WhatsApp message for sending.
Send a broadcast message to multiple contacts using a template.

get.description: List WhatsApp messages with filtering.
Get message details and delivery status.

post.description: Webhook endpoint for WhatsApp status updates from Meta.

get.description: Verify webhook subscription from Meta.
List WhatsApp conversations (24-hour windows).

post.description:
Upload CSV training data.

Supported formats:
- Facebook/Meta Ads CSV (Kaggle)
- Google Ads CSV (Kaggle)
- Generic CSV with spend/impressions/clicks/conversions/revenue columns

The system auto-detects column mappings based on column names.

parameters.name: platform

schema.description: Ad platform (meta, google, tiktok, snapchat, linkedin)
schema.title: Platform

parameters.description: Ad platform (meta, google, tiktok, snapchat, linkedin)

post.description:
Train ML models from uploaded data or sample data.

Models trained:
- roas_predictor: Predicts ROAS from campaign features
- conversion_predictor: Predicts conversions
- budget_impact: Predicts revenue changes from budget changes

parameters.name: data_file

schema.description: Path to training data CSV (uses latest if not specified)
schema.title: Data File

parameters.description: Path to training data CSV (uses latest if not specified)

parameters.name: use_sample_data

schema.description: Use generated sample data instead of uploaded data
schema.title: Use Sample Data

parameters.description: Use generated sample data instead of uploaded data

parameters.name: num_campaigns

schema.description: Number of campaigns for sample data
schema.title: Num Campaigns

parameters.description: Number of campaigns for sample data

parameters.name: days

schema.description: Days per campaign for sample data
schema.title: Days

parameters.description: Days per campaign for sample data

get.description: List all trained ML models and their metadata.

post.description:
Generate sample training data for testing.

Returns the generated data as a downloadable CSV.

get.description: List available training data files.

Get live predictions for the tenant's campaigns.

Returns:
- Portfolio-level analysis with ROAS and potential uplift
- Per-campaign health scores and recommendations
- Active alerts for underperforming campaigns
Get detailed predictions and recommendations for a specific campaign.
Get prediction-based alerts for campaigns.

parameters.name: severity

schema.description: Filter by severity: critical, high, medium, low
schema.title: Severity

parameters.description: Filter by severity: critical, high, medium, low

post.description:
Trigger a refresh of live predictions for the tenant.
Queues a background task.

get.description:
Get budget optimization recommendations across all campaigns.
Returns suggested budget reallocation for maximum ROAS.

Get budget change scenarios for a campaign.
Shows predicted ROAS and revenue at different budget levels.

post.description:
Connect to an ad platform's Conversion API.

Supports:
- Meta (Facebook) - Requires pixel_id, access_token
- Google Ads - Requires customer_id, conversion_action_id, api_key
- TikTok - Requires pixel_code, access_token
- Snapchat - Requires pixel_id, access_token
- LinkedIn - Requires conversion_id, access_token

get.description: Get connection status for all platforms.

post.description: Test all platform connections.

get.description: Get setup requirements for a platform.

post.description:
Stream a single conversion event to connected platforms.

The event will be:
1. User data automatically hashed (SHA256)
2. Event mapped to platform-specific format
3. Sent to all connected platforms (or specified ones)

Stream multiple conversion events to platforms.

Efficient batch processing with:
- Concurrent platform streaming
- Aggregated data quality analysis
- Detailed per-platform results

Analyze data quality for user data.

Returns:
- Score per platform (0-100)
- Missing fields that impact match quality
- Recommendations to improve ROAS

get.description:
Get comprehensive data quality report from recent events.

Includes:
- Overall score and per-platform scores
- Data gaps with severity levels
- Top recommendations to fix
- Estimated ROAS improvement potential

Get live insights from recent events.

Real-time analysis with:
- Current match quality score
- Quality trend (improving/stable/declining)
- Top gaps to fix immediately
- ROAS lift potential

post.description:
Map a custom event to standard platform events.

Shows how your event will be translated for each platform.

Detect PII fields in data.

Identifies what data will be hashed and how.

Hash user data for CAPI transmission.

Automatically detects and hashes PII fields using SHA256.

get.description: Health check for Meta CAPI QA module.
Health check for Landing CMS module.

post.description:
Handle new lead signup from marketing campaign landing page.

This endpoint:
1. Stores the lead with full attribution (UTM + click IDs)
2. Detects which ad platform drove the lead
3. Calculates lead quality score
4. Sends conversion event to ad platforms (CAPI) in background
5. Returns success response immediately

Click ID Parameters (captured from URL):
- fbclid: Meta/Facebook
- gclid: Google Ads
- ttclid: TikTok
- sccid/ScCid: Snapchat
Alias for /subscribe - capture lead from marketing campaign.

get.description:
List all subscribers (admin only).

Requires Authorization header with admin API key.

Get subscriber statistics (admin only).

Returns counts by status, platform, UTM source, etc.

post.description: Export subscribers as CSV or JSON (admin only).

put.description:
Update subscriber status (admin only).

Valid statuses: pending, verified, active, rejected, converted

get.description: Health check for QA Fixes module.

post.description:
Calculate scaling score for a single entity.

Returns a score from -1 to +1:
- >= +0.25: scale candidate
- -0.25 to +0.25: stable/watch
- <= -0.25: fix or pause candidate

Calculate creative fatigue score.

Returns a score from 0 to 1:
- >= 0.65: refresh creative (new hook/visual)
- 0.45 to 0.65: watch, rotate variants
- < 0.45: healthy

Detect anomalies in metrics using Z-score analysis.

Returns anomalies with Z-scores >= 2.5 (configurable).

Check EMQ/signal health status.

Returns:
- healthy: All signals good
- risk: Some signals below target
- degraded: Significant data quality issues
- critical: API down or severe issues

get.description:
Get AI-powered recommendations for the tenant's campaigns.

Returns:
- Recommendations (prioritized actions)
- Budget actions (reallocation suggestions)
- Alerts (anomalies and issues)
- Insights (opportunities)
Get analytics KPIs summary for the dashboard.

Get platform revenue metrics (MRR, ARR, NRR, churn).
SuperAdmin only.
Get revenue breakdown by plan tier.

Get tenant portfolio table with health indicators.
SuperAdmin only.

Get system health metrics.
SuperAdmin only.

Get tenants at churn risk with AI-predicted risk factors.
SuperAdmin only.

Get audit logs with filtering.
SuperAdmin only.

Get all subscription plans with limits.
SuperAdmin only.

patch.description:
Update a subscription plan.
SuperAdmin only.

get.description:
Get all invoices across tenants.
SuperAdmin only.

Get all active subscriptions.
SuperAdmin only.

post.description:
Perform action on subscription (upgrade, downgrade, cancel, etc).
SuperAdmin only.

get.description:
Get tenant usage vs limits (for overage warnings).
SuperAdmin only.

Get Super Admin dashboard summary.
Combines revenue, health, and alerts.

List all landing page subscribers.
SuperAdmin only.

Get detailed subscriber information.
SuperAdmin only.

patch.description:
Update subscriber status or notes.
SuperAdmin only.

delete.description:
Delete a subscriber record.
SuperAdmin only.

get.description:
Export subscribers to CSV format.
SuperAdmin only.

Get dashboard overview with KPIs for a tenant.

Returns spend, revenue, ROAS, CPA metrics with period comparisons.

Get AI-powered recommendations for tenant campaigns.

Returns prioritized list of actions: scale, watch, fix, pause, creative_refresh.

Get alerts for a tenant.

Filter by severity (low, medium, high, critical) and type (anomaly, fatigue, budget, signal).

post.description:
Acknowledge an alert.

Marks the alert as seen by the user without resolving the underlying issue.

Resolve an alert.

Marks the alert as resolved with optional resolution notes.

get.description: Get tenant settings and configuration.

put.description:
Update tenant settings.

Requires TENANT_SETTINGS permission.

get.description:
Get Command Center data with scaling scores and recommended actions.

Returns campaigns grouped by recommended action (scale, watch, fix, pause).

Get platform-wide overview metrics.

Returns:
- total_tenants: Total number of tenants
- active_tenants: Tenants with recent activity
- total_actions: Total autopilot actions
- success_rate: Action success rate
- signal_health_summary: Aggregated signal health

Get tenant profitability metrics.

Returns profitability analysis per tenant including:
- Revenue metrics
- Action efficiency
- Signal health score

Get platform-wide signal health trends.

Returns daily aggregates of signal health metrics.

Get platform-wide autopilot actions analytics.

Returns action type breakdown, status distribution, and daily trends.

Get current autopilot status and configuration.

Returns:
- autopilot_level: Current level (0=suggest, 1=guarded, 2=approval)
- pending_actions: Number of actions awaiting approval
- caps: Budget/action caps for guarded mode
- enabled: Whether autopilot is enabled

Get actions for a tenant.

Query params:
- date: Filter by date
- status: Filter by status (queued, approved, applied, failed, dismissed)
- platform: Filter by platform
- limit: Max results (default 50)

post.description:
Queue a new action.
Actions will be auto-executed or require approval based on autopilot level.

get.description: Get summary of actions over the past N days.

post.description: Approve a queued action for execution.
Approve multiple queued actions at once.
Dismiss a queued action (won't be executed).

get.description: Get details of a specific action.

Get current enforcement settings for tenant.

Returns full enforcement configuration including:
- enforcement_enabled (kill switch status)
- default_mode (advisory/soft_block/hard_block)
- Budget thresholds
- ROAS thresholds
- Frequency limits
- Custom rules

put.description:
Update enforcement settings for tenant.

Requires admin role.

post.description:
Check if a proposed action is allowed under enforcement rules.

Returns:
- allowed: Whether the action is permitted
- mode: Enforcement mode that applied
- violations: List of rule violations (if any)
- warnings: Human-readable warning messages
- requires_confirmation: Whether soft-block confirmation is needed
- confirmation_token: Token to use for confirmation (if soft-blocked)

Confirm a soft-blocked action to proceed.

Requires the confirmation_token from the enforcement check response.
Override reason is logged for audit purposes.

Enable or disable enforcement for the entire tenant.

This is a kill switch that immediately stops all enforcement checks.
All changes are logged for audit purposes.

get.description:
Get audit log of all enforcement interventions.

Returns history of:
- Blocked actions
- Warnings issued
- Override confirmations
- Kill switch changes
- Auto-pause events

post.description:
Add a custom enforcement rule.

Custom rules allow fine-grained control over specific thresholds
and can have different enforcement modes than the default.

get.description: Get connection status for a platform.

post.description:
Start OAuth flow for a platform.
Returns the authorization URL to redirect the user.
Refresh OAuth token for a platform.

get.description: List ad accounts for a platform.

post.description: Trigger ad accounts sync from platform.

put.description: Update ad account settings (enable/disable, budget cap).

post.description: Create a new campaign draft.

get.description: List campaign drafts with optional filters.
Get a specific campaign draft.

put.description: Update a campaign draft (only allowed in draft status).

post.description: Submit draft for approval.
Approve a submitted draft (requires CAMPAIGN_APPROVE permission).
Reject a submitted draft.
Publish an approved campaign draft to the platform.

get.description: List publish logs with optional filters.

post.description: Retry a failed publish attempt.

get.description:
Get feature flags for the current tenant.
Returns merged flags (plan defaults + tenant overrides).

put.description:
Update feature flags for the current tenant.
Requires tenant_admin role.

get.description: Get feature flags for any tenant (superadmin only).

put.description: Update feature flags for any tenant (superadmin only).

post.description: Reset tenant features to plan defaults (superadmin only).

get.description: Get feature categories and descriptions for UI.

Get daily insights for a tenant.

Returns aggregated view of:
- KPIs and trends
- Top actions/recommendations
- Risks and opportunities
- Autopilot status

Requires feature flag: ai_recommendations

Get detailed recommendations for a tenant.

Each recommendation includes:
- type: budget_shift, creative_refresh, fix_campaign, etc.
- entity: campaign/adset/creative with ID and name
- title: human-readable action title
- why: list of reasons/factors
- confidence: 0-1 confidence score
- risk: low/medium/high
- guardrails: any caps or limits applied

schema.description: Filter by entity type: campaign, adset, creative
schema.title: Entity Type

parameters.description: Filter by entity type: campaign, adset, creative

parameters.name: priority

schema.description: Filter by priority: critical, high, medium, low
schema.title: Priority

parameters.description: Filter by priority: critical, high, medium, low

get.description:
Get anomaly alerts for a tenant.

Detects unusual patterns in:
- Spend spikes/drops
- ROAS changes
- CPA anomalies
- Conversion rate shifts

Requires feature flag: anomaly_alerts

parameters.name: days

schema.description: Days to look back for anomaly detection
schema.title: Days

schema.description: Filter by severity: critical, high, medium, low
schema.title: Severity

get.description:
Get key performance indicators for a tenant.

Returns aggregated metrics with trends:
- Total spend
- Total revenue
- ROAS
- CPA
- Conversions
- CTR

Get signal health status and metrics for the tenant.

Returns:
- status: Overall health status (ok/risk/degraded/critical)
- automation_blocked: Whether automation should be blocked
- cards: Metric summary cards
- platform_rows: Per-platform breakdown
- banners: Trust banners to display

Get signal health history for the past N days.
Useful for trend analysis and reporting.

Get attribution variance between platform and GA4.

Returns:
- status: Variance status (healthy/minor/moderate/high)
- overall_revenue_variance_pct: Overall revenue variance percentage
- cards: Summary metric cards
- platform_rows: Per-platform breakdown
- banners: Attribution variance banners

Get combined trust status including signal health and attribution variance.
This is the main endpoint for the Trust Layer banner/status.

Returns:
- overall_status: Combined trust status
- automation_allowed: Whether automation can proceed
- signal_health: Signal health summary (if enabled)
- attribution_variance: Attribution variance summary (if enabled)
- banners: Combined banners to display
Get the current EMQ score and drivers for a tenant.
Get detailed confidence band information and contributing factors.
Get prioritized list of recommended fixes to improve EMQ score.

patch.description: Update the status or owner of a playbook item.

get.description: Get EMQ-related incidents and events within a date range.
Get estimated ROAS impact due to EMQ issues.
Get signal volatility index and trend data.
Get current autopilot mode and restrictions based on EMQ.

put.description: Manually override autopilot mode (requires elevated permissions).

get.description: Get platform-wide EMQ benchmarks (super admin only).
Get portfolio-wide EMQ overview (super admin only).

post.description:
Start HubSpot OAuth authorization flow.
Returns authorization URL to redirect user to HubSpot.

get.description:
Handle HubSpot OAuth callback.
Exchanges authorization code for tokens and stores connection.
Get current HubSpot connection status for tenant.

post.description:
Trigger manual sync of HubSpot contacts and deals.
Can run as background task for large syncs.

Receive and process HubSpot webhooks.
Validates signature and queues events for processing.

get.description: Get CRM pipeline summary with stage counts and values.

Get Pipeline ROAS metrics comparing ad spend to CRM outcomes.

Returns:
- Platform ROAS (platform-reported revenue / spend)
- Pipeline ROAS (pipeline value / spend)
- Won ROAS (won revenue / spend)
- Funnel conversion rates

Get attribution report for won deals grouped by dimension.

Shows which campaigns/platforms are driving closed revenue.
List synced CRM contacts with optional filters.
List synced CRM deals with optional filters.

post.description:
Run identity matching to link CRM contacts to ad touchpoints.
This enables attribution reporting.

get.description:
Get HubSpot writeback configuration and status.

Returns current settings, property setup status, and last sync details.

post.description:
Create Stratum custom properties in HubSpot.

Creates a property group and custom properties for both contacts and deals
to store attribution data:
- Contact: ad platform, campaign, attribution confidence, touchpoints
- Deal: attributed spend, revenue ROAS, profit ROAS, days to close

Should be run once during initial setup.

Run HubSpot writeback sync.

Pushes Stratum attribution data to HubSpot contacts and deals:
- Contact: ad platform, campaign, ad IDs, attribution confidence
- Deal: attributed spend, ROAS, profit metrics, touchpoint count

By default, only syncs records modified since last sync (incremental).
Use full_sync=true to sync all records.

get.description: Get history of writeback sync operations.

post.description:
Create a new target.

Targets define goals for metrics like spend, revenue, or ROAS
over a specific period (monthly, quarterly, etc.).

schema.title: Response Create Target Api V1 Pacing Targets Post

get.description: List all targets with optional filters.

schema.title: Response List Targets Api V1 Pacing Targets Get

get.description: Get a specific target by ID.

schema.title: Response Get Target Api V1 Pacing Targets  Target Id  Get
Response Update Target Api V1 Pacing Targets  Target Id  Patch
Response Delete Target Api V1 Pacing Targets  Target Id  Delete

get.description:
Get pacing metrics for a specific target.

Returns MTD actual vs expected, pacing percentage, EOM projections,
and status flags (on_track, at_risk, will_miss).

schema.title: Response Get Target Pacing Api V1 Pacing Pacing Target  Target Id  Get

get.description:
Get pacing for all active targets.

Returns a summary of targets on track, at risk, and will miss,
along with individual pacing details for each target.

schema.title: Response Get All Pacing Api V1 Pacing Pacing All Get

get.description:
Get historical pacing snapshots for a target.

Returns daily pacing snapshots for trend analysis.

schema.title: Response Get Pacing History Api V1 Pacing Pacing History  Target Id  Get

post.description:
Create pacing snapshots for all active targets.

Used for historical trend tracking. Should be run daily via cron.

schema.title: Response Create Pacing Snapshots Api V1 Pacing Pacing Snapshot Post

post.description:
Generate a forecast for a metric.

Uses EWMA (Exponentially Weighted Moving Average) with day-of-week
seasonality adjustment. Returns daily point forecasts with confidence
intervals.

schema.title: Response Create Forecast Api V1 Pacing Forecast Post

get.description:
Get end-of-month forecast for a metric.

Returns MTD actual, remaining forecast, and projected EOM value
with confidence intervals.

schema.title: Response Get Eom Forecast Api V1 Pacing Forecast Eom Get

get.description: Get alerts with optional filters.

schema.title: Response Get Alerts Api V1 Pacing Alerts Get

get.description: Get alert summary statistics for a time period.

schema.title: Response Get Alert Summary Api V1 Pacing Alerts Summary Get

post.description:
Check all targets for alert conditions.

Creates new alerts for any targets that are underpacing, overpacing,
or at risk of missing their targets.

schema.title: Response Check All Alerts Api V1 Pacing Alerts Check Post

post.description:
Calculate attribution for a single deal.

Applies the specified attribution model and returns the full breakdown
of credit assigned to each touchpoint.

Batch attribute multiple deals.

If deal_ids not provided, attributes all unattributed won deals in the date range.

get.description:
Compare attribution results across different models.

Shows how attributed revenue differs by campaign/platform
when using different attribution models.

parameters.name: models

schema.description: Comma-separated list of models to compare (first_touch,last_touch,linear,position_based,time_decay)
schema.title: Models

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of models to compare (first_touch,last_touch,linear,position_based,time_decay)

get.description:
Get attribution summary grouped by dimension.

Returns attributed revenue and deal count by platform, campaign, etc.
Get attribution details for a specific campaign.

Get complete journey for a single contact.

Returns timeline of touchpoints and deals with full attribution details.

Get most common paths that lead to conversions.

Shows which channel sequences most frequently result in won deals.

parameters.name: path_by

schema.description: Group path by: platform or campaign
schema.title: Path By

parameters.description: Group path by: platform or campaign

schema.title: Response Get Top Conversion Paths Api V1 Attribution Journeys Conversion Paths Get

get.description:
Get channel transition data for Sankey diagram visualization.

Shows how users move between channels during their journey.

Get aggregate journey metrics for the tenant.

Includes average touches, time to conversion, channel usage.

Get assisted conversion metrics.

Shows which channels/campaigns assist conversions (not last touch)
vs. which directly convert (last touch).

schema.title: Response Get Assisted Conversions Api V1 Attribution Journeys Assisted Conversions Get

get.description:
Get time lag analysis between first touch and conversion.

Shows distribution of how long it takes users to convert.
List available attribution models with descriptions.

post.description:
Preview attribution weights for a given model and touchpoint count.

Useful for understanding how different models distribute credit.

Train a data-driven attribution model.

Supports:
- **markov_chain**: Uses transition probabilities and removal effects
- **shapley_value**: Uses game theory for fair credit distribution

Requires sufficient historical journey data for training.

Train all available model types and compare results.

Returns attribution weights from both Markov Chain and Shapley Value models,
along with a consensus (averaged) weight distribution.

get.description:
Get a recommendation for which attribution model to use.

Analyzes journey characteristics (length, channel diversity, data volume)
to recommend the most appropriate model type.

post.description:
Attribute a deal using a trained data-driven model.

Pass the model_data from a previous training response.
Batch attribute multiple deals using a trained model.

Validate a trained model on holdout data.

Tests the model's attribution accuracy on data not used for training.

Compare data-driven weights with rule-based attribution models.

Shows correlation between data-driven results and traditional models
(first touch, last touch, linear, position-based, time decay).

get.description: List available data-driven model types with descriptions.

Check if there's sufficient data for model training.

Returns data availability and recommendations.
